Set1.description: This assignment will develop your familiarity with doing simple computations in JavaScript.

savings.description: Calculate the money remaining for an employee after taxes and expenses.
steps: Apply the tax rate to the gross pay of the employee, round down.
Subtract the expenses from the after-tax pay of the employee.

grossPay.description: The gross pay of an employee for a certain time period, expressed in centavos

taxRate.description: The tax rate for a certain time period, expressed as a number between 0 and 1 (e.g., 0.12)

expenses.description: The expenses of an employee for a certain time period, expressed in centavos

returns.description: The number of centavos remaining from an employee's pay after taxes and expenses

materialWaste.description: Calculate how much material input will be wasted after running a number of jobs that consume a set amount of material.
steps: Multiply the number of jobs by the material consumption per job.
Subtract the total material consumed from the total material available.
materialWaste.notes: Format the output as a string, annotated with the units in which the material is expressed. Do not add a space between the number and the unit.

materialUnits.description: The units in which the material is expressed.

jobConsumption.description: The amount of material consumed per job.

returns.description: The amount of remaining material expressed with its unit (e.g., '10kg')

interest.description: Calculate the final value of an investment after gaining simple interest over a number of periods.
steps: Calculate simple interest by multiplying the principal to the quantity (rate * time).
Add this amount to the principal to get the final value.

principal.description: The principal, or starting, amount invested, expressed in centavos

rate.description: The interest rate per period, expressed as a decimal representation of a percentage (e.g., 3% is 0.03)

returns.description: The final value of the investment
